content.text:
[@alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) [@staltzphone](@+UMKhpbzXAII+2/7ZlsgkJwIsxdfeFi36Z5Rk1gCfY0=.ed25519) [@kas](@dBQlwh9Gtr3i5YMOGtIOKtGNVepeu+nyb6KGl1vtOcM=.ed25519) 

I just checked it out and this looks fantastic. I wonder how many people are responsible for curating this list, as I'm sure it would be of interest of anyone looking to influence the media we consume. On the other hand, I'm sure *anything* is better than getting news from corporate media like Reddit, Twitter, Facebook, or even traditional news media companies.

[@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) 

DW looks great, thanks for the recommendation! I'm living in a cesspool of USA-centric news (and USA-centric everything, as I'm living here), so it's really interesting to see stories that I haven't been exposed to at all.

[@Matt Lorentz](@kS1GT34Sg+Kzjcqoehz//afmIQC5+CGo8O/KvMddVrM=.ed25519) 

Did somebody say [RSS feed](https://www.to-rss.xyz/wikipedia/current_events/)? :link:
